summary: Email correspondence between Assistant United States Attorneys from the Southern District of New York and Dr. Lisa Rocchio regarding the review and finalization of an expert notice intended for defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The document shows the prosecution preparing expert witness disclosure.

persons.name: Lisa Rocchio
persons.role: Expert Witness / Clinical and Forensic Psychologist
persons.context: A clinical and forensic psychologist being disclosed by the prosecution as an expert witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The prosecution is sending her a draft expert notice for review.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: An Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York corresponding with Dr. Rocchio about the expert notice draft and scheduling a call.

connections.description: Prosecution attorney (AUSA) coordinating with a retained expert witness (psychologist) regarding the disclosure of her anticipated testimony to the defense.

events.title: Revised Expert Notice Draft Sent
events.description: A revised draft of an expert notice regarding Dr. Lisa Rocchio's anticipated testimony is sent by the prosecution to Dr. Rocchio for final review before being sent to defense counsel.

events.title: Call Scheduled Regarding Expert Notice
events.description: A call is scheduled between Dr. Rocchio and the prosecution team for Wednesday evening after 5:15 PM to discuss the expert notice.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Alpert Medical School of Brown University
keyFacts: The prosecution in the Ghislaine Maxwell case was preparing to disclose Dr. Lisa Rocchio as an expert witness.
Dr. Lisa Rocchio is a clinical and forensic psychologist based in Rhode Island and a Clinical Instructor at Brown University's medical school.
The correspondence shows the procedural steps of expert witness disclosure, with the prosecution drafting a notice for the expert's review before sending it to defense counsel.
The timeline was urgent, with the prosecution needing to finalize the notice by the end of the week of April 19, 2021.
The document is part of the pre-trial discovery and disclosure process in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
